strategy: The main goal of this deck is to play Sagas. Sagas are a type of enchantment where each "chapter" allows for things to happen. When you're at 4 total counters across all Sagas, Tom Bombadil gets indestructible and hexproof. So you just keep playing those sagas, and everything will go swimmingly.

notableCards.name: Scroll of Isildur
notableCards.description: This is an example of the Saga's you'll be playing. Some draw cards, like this one, others create tokens or destroy creatures. They are the key to your deck; make sure you have them in hand!

notableCards.name: Archon of Sun's Grace
notableCards.description: Cards like these provide you with payoffs for casting Sagas. They are especially helpful to develop your gameplan to a win!

notableCards.name: Glissa Sunslayer
notableCards.description: There are a smattering of cards, like this, that remove cards from your sagas to keep them around. They will be extraordinarily helpful to get the counters up.

notableCards.name: Rampant Growth
notableCards.description: Ramp cards like this are so you can have access to all five colors you need to cast Tom Bombadil on curve.

turnByTurnGuide.actions: Play lands and ramp pieces to get your hands on the colors you need. Don't be afraid to focus on ramping.
Continue looking for the right colors. Play your first Saga, ideally right before you play Tom Bombadil

turnByTurnGuide.goal: Play Commander and Throw Down Sagas
turnByTurnGuide.actions: Play Tom Bombadil. Use him to cheat out Sagas, and use your Sagas to draw cards and manipulate counters. Build up value as much as you can.
By now you should be unstoppable. Use your Sagas and other pieces to crush the board with your overwhelming value.
